description: Sum of the squares of the divisors of n is divisible by n.
comments: Compare with multiply perfect numbers A007691. Here Sum[ divisors ] is replaced by Sum[ square of divisors ].Problem 11090 proves that this sequence is infinite. - _T. D. Noe_, Apr 18 2006
references: Florian Luca, Problem 11090: Sometimes n divides sigma_k(n), Amer. Math. Monthly 113 (2006), 372-373.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
maple: with(numtheory);A046762:=proc(q)local a,i,n;for n from 1 to q do  a:=divisors(n); if frac(add(a[i]^2,i=1..nops(a))/n)=0 then print(n);fi; od; end:A046762(100000);  # [_Paolo P. Lava_, Dec 07 2012]
author: _Labos Elemer_
